The Warrington Stone Bridge is a historic stone arch bridge carrying Brugler Road over the Paulins Kill in the Warrington section of Knowlton Township in Warren County, New Jersey, United States. The bridge was built  and added to the National Register of Historic Places on December 16, 1977, for its significance in transportation.
History and description
The one-lane stone bridge was built in the mid 19th century, , and has six barrel-vaulted arches. Its overall length is  and width . According to the nomination form, it is the "largest extant 19th century stone arch bridge in New Jersey" and "one of the most graceful and geometrically
correct". It was repaired in 1915 and 1990.
